title: Welcome!
text:
Originally from Texas, Coda was adopted from Fort Collins‚Äô Animal Friends Alliance in January 2023. Though she was a full-grown two-year-old cat, she weighed only 5 pounds. From the start, she was incredibly vocal and affectionate- although still very cautious and timid around strangers.




Although very vocal, she doesn‚Äôt have a proper ‚Äúmeow‚Äù. Instead, she has a whole vocabulary of ‚Äúchirps‚Äù, ‚Äúsqueaks‚Äù, and the occasional high-pitched sustained ‚ÄúSQUEEE!‚Äù.
Coda strictly enforces a bedtime for the house- crying insistently if everyone isn‚Äôt settled into the bedroom by midnight.
Since discovering her love of diced cucumbers, she now assumes anything being chopped in the kitchen must be cucumbers and will beg relentlessly until she‚Äôs shown‚Äîand convinced‚Äîthat it‚Äôs something else.









A scrawny Coda her first month in her new home.







Coda enjoys the sunshine while harshly judging the neighbors.





Hanging out with her dad.

title: Adoption Resources
text:
Coda was adopted from:
Animal Friends Alliance They focus on:

Rescuing cats
TNR (trap-neuter-return)
Adoption counseling
Fostering programs

Please consider adopting ‚Äî there are so many wonderful cats waiting for homes!





Coda enjoying her wall.







Hanging with her ‚ÄòSharky‚Äô.







The princess in her tower.




::::::::

summary(cars)

When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

summary(cars)

 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00

title: PLOTFORCAT
text:
Including Plots
You can also embed plots, for example:









Note that the echo = FALSE parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

#install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("R-CoderDotCom/ggcats@main")

Skipping install of 'ggcats' from a github remote, the SHA1 (f8b87909) has not changed since last install.
  Use `force = TRUE` to force installation



# Load packages
library(ggplot2)
library(ggcats)

~~ Package ggcats
Visit https://r-coder.com/ for R tutorials ~~

library(dplyr)


Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

set.seed(1)

# Create 24 months of data
months <- seq.Date(from = as.Date("2023-01-01"),
                   to   = as.Date("2024-12-01"),
                   by = "month")

# Make up interest levels (0‚Äì10)
df <- data.frame(
  month = rep(months, each = 4),
  toy = rep(c("Shark stuffy",
              "Laser pointer",
              "Empty box",
              "Expensive electric toy"), times = length(months)),
  cat = rep(c("grumpy",      # Shark stuffy
              "bongo",       # Laser pointer
              "toast",       # Empty box
              "nyancat"),    # Expensive electric toy
             times = length(months))
)

# Add invented interest patterns
df <- df %>%
  mutate(interest =
           case_when(
             toy == "Shark stuffy" ~ pmin(10, 6 + sin(as.numeric(month)/50)*3 + rnorm(1,0,1)),
             toy == "Laser pointer" ~ runif(n(), 7, 10),
             toy == "Empty box" ~ pmin(10, 5 + cos(as.numeric(month)/40)*3 + runif(1,0,2)),
             
             # Expensive toy: brief early interest, then drops to nothing
             toy == "Expensive electric toy" ~
               ifelse(month < as.Date("2023-04-01"),
                      runif(n(), 7, 10),
                      runif(n(), 0, 2))
           )
  )


ggplot(df, aes(month, interest)) +
  geom_line(aes(color = toy), linewidth = 2, alpha = 0.6) +
  geom_cat(aes(cat = cat), size = 2) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10), breaks = 0:10) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c(
    "Shark stuffy" = "#3581B8",
    "Laser pointer" = "#E63946",
    "Empty box" = "#6A994E",
    "Expensive electric toy" = "#9D4EDD"
  )) +
  labs(
    title = "Coda's Interest Over Time",
    y = "Interest Level (0‚Äì10)",
    x = "Month",
    color = "Toy"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  theme(panel.grid.minor = element_blank())
